introduction.para: This document details a pre-ride check list to ensure bicycle safety and proper functionality. Following these steps before each ride will minimize the risk of mechanical failure and enhance rider safety.

tool_equipment.item: (Optional) Torque wrench (for fasteners - refer to component specifications)

procedure_step.action: Check the overall condition of the bike before every ride.

condition.abnormal: Any visible damage or unusual wear.

procedure_step.action: Check all fasteners (bolts, nuts, quick releases) for tightness.

condition.normal: All fasteners are secure and tight.
condition.warning: Incorrect tightening force can result in component failure, leading to loss of control.
condition.remedy: Tighten and torque fastener according to specific maintenance instruction for the related component.

procedure_step.action: Lift the front wheel off the ground 2-3 inches and bounce it on the ground.

condition.abnormal: Bike rattles or parts appear loose.
condition.remedy: Secure the loose part according to the specific maintenance instruction for the related part.

condition.normal: Tire pressure is correct according to the specification printed on the tire sidewall.
condition.abnormal: Tire pressure is outside the specified range.
condition.high_pressure: Bleed air from the tire until it reaches the maximum pressure printed on the sidewall.
condition.low_pressure: Add air to the tire, not exceeding the maximum pressure printed on the sidewall.

procedure_step.action: Inspect the tire for cuts or cracks.

condition.normal: Tire has no cuts or cracks.
condition.warning: Riding on a damaged tire could cause tire failure, leading to loss of control.

procedure_step.action: Spin each wheel and observe for wobble.

condition.caution: Wheels must be true for rim brakes to work effectively.
condition.remedy: Have the bike serviced to true the wheels.

condition.normal: No wear indicator marks are visible on the rim.
condition.abnormal: Wear indicator marks are visible on the rim.
condition.warning: Riding on a rim at the end of its life can result in wheel failure and loss of control.

condition.normal: Front and rear brakes securely grip the wheel rim. Brake lever movement is within 1 inch.

abnormal.remedy: Tighten brakes according to maintenance procedure. Check/replace brake cables if necessary.
Tighten brakes according to maintenance procedure.
